New Records: Suryakumar Yadav became the first Indian and only second in the world to score 1000 runs in T20Is in a calendar year.
Ravichandran Ashwin surpassed Jasprit Bumrah to become the third-highest leading wicket-taker for India in T20Is.
Key Match Events: India won the match by 71 runs.
Suryakumar Yadav and KL Rahul scored significant centuries.
Ravichandran Ashwin took crucial wickets, including a double-wicket over.
Pre-Game Insights: India opted to bat first after winning the toss.
Rishabh Pant was included in the playing XI ahead of Dinesh Karthik.
The match was crucial for India to top Group 2 and for Zimbabwe to qualify for the next T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: India secured a semifinal spot in the T20 World Cup 2022.
Rohit Sharma became the third Indian captain after MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli to lead in 50 T20Is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The highest total at the Melbourne Cricket Ground was updated to 183 by India.
Zimbabwe's playing XI included changes with Wellington and Munyonga in, while Milton and Luke Jongwe were out.
Others: The match was played at the MCG, and the weather conditions were favorable but had a slight chance of rain.
